title: What is the profit or loss % when a boy bought 4 mangoes for ₹5 and sold them @ 5 mangoes for ₹4? - Quora
tags: State Bank of India Probationary Officer
Staff Selection Commission Combined Graduate Level Exam

response.answer_text: Always compare Selling price and Cost price for the same Quantity of the particular item ( here mangoes is the item ) . Generally, in the answers to such questions people compare CP and SP for 1 item but you can compare for any fixed amount ( 100 , 200 , 541 , 98 , etc. ) let's say for x amount. CP of 4 mangoes = rs. 5 CP of x mangoes = rs. (5/4)*x SP of 5 mangoes = rs. 4 SP of x mangoes = rs. (4/5)*x Now (5/4)*x>(4/5)*x ( x being a positive whole number ) Hence there occurs a loss as CP > SP ( for x mangoes ) . Loss = [(5/4)-(4/5)]*x = (9/20)*x So loss % = (loss/CP) * 100 = (9/20)*(4/5)*100 = 36

Let’s make it short. CP of 4 Mangoes - Rs.5CP of 1 Mango - Rs.5/4CP of 5 Mangoes - Rs. 5*5/4. Rs - 6.25 SP of 5 Mangoes - Rs 4CP>SP (LOSS)LOSS%= (LOSS(6.25–4)/CP) *100 LOSS%= (2.25/6.25) *1OO = 36% P.S.- Basically such type of questions are about equating either CP o 1 commodity to SP of 1 commodity OR SP of given commodity to the CP of same.
